articles.title: Glacial Pathfinders: Tracing North America's First Migrants via the Sea Ice Highway - SciTechDaily
articles.description: New research suggests some early Americans may have traveled on winter sea ice down the coast from Beringia as long as 24,000 years ago. One of the hottest debates in archeology is how and when humans first arrived in North America. Archaeologists have tradit…
articles.content: New findings suggest early humans arrived in North America earlier than 13,000 years ago, possibly using a “sea ice highway” along the Pacific Coast. This theory, supported by paleoclimate data, chal… [+4677 chars]

articles.title: Study suggests first people reached North America via ‘sea ice highway’ around 24,000 years ago - WION
